STEVE JACKSON

Steve Jackson, co-founder and Director of renowned games development outfit Lionhead Studios, has long held a venerated position within the world of interactive games, with a string of established successes such as the Games Workshop, F.I.S.T, Battlecards and the Fighting Fantasy Gamebook series already under his belt.

Steve Jackson is also an old hand at designing games played over telephone networks. In 1989 he wrote and directed the world's first telephone adventure game: F.I.S.T. (Fantasy Interactive Scenarios by Telephone). FIST played like an interactive radio drama. It was a lavish production, using professional voice actors and hundreds of different sound effects.

"FIST has done incredibly well," said Jackson, "But it had limitations, as it has only been available to callers within a single territory. WAP-enabled phones have much more potential and, in theory, anyone in the world can play Sorcery on-line. It's a scary thought."
